result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Lee Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
03/14/2016 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR FROM 5/7/16 TO 5/7/17.
04/28/2017 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR FROM 5/7/17 TO 5/7/18.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
03/22/2016 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO MAKE $50.00 MONTHLY PAYMENTS TOWARDS RESTITUTION BEGINNING MAY 1, 2016.

10/18/2016  AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO MAKE $25.00 MONTHLY PAYMENTS TOWARDS RESTITUTION, BUT A $50.00 PAYMENT MUST BE MADE TO PROBATION BY 10/21/2016.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must comply with Chapter 51 treatment.
03-22-2016 AMENDED TO ADD CONDITION OF MUST SEEK WORK IF UNEMPLOYED OR UNDER EMPLOYED AND MUST APPLY AT A MINIMUM OF 5 PLACES PER WEEK, KEEP A LOG AND PROVIDE THE LOG TO THE PROBATION AGENT.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Must report to jail by 2:30 PM today, May 7, 2015. Court grants work release and work search.

supervisions.notes: Restitution to be paid through the order to show cause process.
Court costs are reduced to civil judgment.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked - sentence is imposed.
